item.title: Near rubbish bin, 14th July
item.description:

item.title: Sink hole opening up in Elcot Avenue, 14th July

item.title: Yellow cover on footpath, 14th July
item.description:
This yellow cover on the footpath had been on it for well over 12 months. Can it be removed please as the surface is uneven. The cover makes it hard for wheelchairs, buggies & people with walking sticks to get over it. H&S hazard. Thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Francis Street, Victoria, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There is a raised area of tarmac approx 8 inches high like a boil, 14th July
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): East Lodge Lane, London

item.category: Tree overhanging the highway from private property

item.title: Vandalised fence, 14th July
item.description:
Afternoon of Monday 14th July some youths ripped out the fence in front of number 20. It is now in a dangerous position encroaching on the path. When the gas work was done recently the contractors put the fence panels back in the wrong places and screws were missing. The residents would actually prefer you remove the entire fence as it only encourages littering and antisocial behaviour, aside from looking very ugly and outdated.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Flintmill Crescent, Well Hall, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken fridge on the street, 14th July
item.description:
A large white refrigerator or freezer appliance has been abandoned on the pavement/street. The appliance appears to be broken or non-functional, with its door open and various parts scattered around. Why this is problematic? It's blocking public walkways and creating an obstruction for pedestrians Large appliances contain refrigerants and other materials that require proper disposal at licensed facilities It creates an eyesore and can encourage further illegal dumping in the area It poses potential safety hazards, especially the open door which could trap children

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 75, Narbonne Avenue, Clapham, London
